intro: Henriettella fissanthera, commonly known as the golden bell vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble small bells, which bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Henriettella fissanthera is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, which includes other ornamental and economically important plants.
